description: A 6.8 magnitude earthquake strikes Metro City. Multiple building collapses, fires, and infrastructure damage requiring coordinated emergency response.

data.content: Severe structural collapse at 500 Market Street. Multi-story building pancake collapse. Heavy debris field covering full block. Active fire visible in eastern section. Smoke rising. Possible survivors in debris.
OMG major collapse on Market Street!! Building completely down!! Everyone stay away!! People screaming!! #MetroCityQuake #Emergency

data.transcript: Unit 7 to dispatch - code red at 500 Market Street. We have a full pancake collapse, floors 2 through 4. Multiple people trapped. I can hear at least 5 voices calling for help. Stairwells compromised, approach from west side only. Requesting SAR team and minimum 3 ambulances. This is a mass casualty incident.

data.content: Active fire visible in Sector 3 residential district. Large smoke column rising. Fire spreading to adjacent structures. Two residential buildings affected. Possible gas feed.

Metro General Hospital Status: Current ER capacity at 45% (90/200 beds occupied). Accepting trauma cases. All surgical teams activated. Recommend diverting non-critical cases to St. Mary's Medical Center.

data.transcript: This is a 911 call - my name is Sarah Chen, I am trapped in my apartment at 847 Oak Street, third floor. The staircase has completely collapsed. There are 4 of us including my two children ages 6 and 9. The building is shaking. Please send help immediately. We cannot get out.

data.temporal_analysis: Satellite image captured at 14:40 shows bridge intact. Audio report at 15:01 states bridge collapsed. 21-minute gap is sufficient time for collapse to occur post-earthquake.

claims.claim: Main Street Bridge has collapsed - main span down, completely impassable. Do not route vehicles through Sector 2.
Main Street Bridge appears structurally intact - no visible collapse damage or major structural deformation observed from satellite.

data.temporal_analysis: On-scene audio report and official hospital intake report disagree on casualty numbers from the same incident within 8 minutes.

claims.claim: Minimum 12-15 casualties at Market Street collapse. Multiple non-responsive victims visible in debris. Mass casualty protocol required.
Metro General has received only 3 patients from Market Street incident so far. No mass casualty declaration warranted at this time.

data.temporal_analysis: Utility company report and civilian report give conflicting information about the gas line status in Sector 3.

claims.claim: Sector 3 gas pressure nominal. No rupture detected by automated sensors. Safe for emergency personnel to enter.
Strong smell of gas on Oak Street, Sector 3. Hissing sound near the intersection. I can see a crack in the road. This is a gas leak emergency.

data.content: HELI-1 AERIAL VERIFICATION - Main Street Bridge: CONFIRMED COLLAPSE. Western span has failed catastrophically. Approximately 40% of bridge deck collapsed into waterway. Eastern approach still standing but structurally compromised. Bridge is completely impassable. Emergency vehicles must use alternate route via Harbor Boulevard.

911 Call Transcript: Caller at Oak Street and 5th Avenue, apartment 3B. Reports 4 people trapped including 2 children. Building partially collapsed. Multiple voices heard from adjacent units. No immediate fire hazard visible. Access via rear entrance possibly viable.

data.label: Planning Agent generating resource allocation recommendation...

data.content: Secondary collapse in Sector 3 following 4.2M aftershock. Three-story residential building on Elm Street partially collapsed - eastern wall failure. Active fire from Sector 3 advancing toward building. Additional casualties expected.

UTILITY ALERT - PG&E: Gas rupture detected at Oak Street and Elm Avenue intersection, Sector 3. Estimated flow rate high. Field repair crews dispatched, ETA 25 minutes. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED: Establish 200-meter evacuation radius. Do not allow open flames or electrical equipment in zone.
